intro: Perymenium glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular perymenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant has hairy or glandular surfaces, which contribute to its scientific name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Perymenium glandulosum is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
